channel.title: Updating
channel.description:
How do you make it so your run energy, coordinates, and your players online numbers change every 500ms??
~On my server they don't change, they change when you first log in, but will never change again unless you log out/in again. Then some dude posted that you have to update it every 500ms, so now I'm asking how i do that??
~And is there a way for, when a player changes there attack style, and hits a dummy, they get different xp? Example: The player changes there attack style to defense or strength, they will get that xp instead of just attack xp all the time.
~Also i added this into my server and it doesn't seem to be working.
[code]public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) { }
public void Deleteobjects() { deletethatobject(3238, 3435); //delete bench deletethatobject(3255, 3432); //delete Table deletethatobject(3255, 3434); //delete Table deletethatobject(3255, 3431); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3255, 3432); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3256, 3431); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3257, 3433); //delete Stool deletethatobject(3251, 3431); //delete Stool }[/code]
I entered that code right under the section where globalobjects were made.
Helps appreciated! ;D

item.title: Updating
item.dc:creator: @Bloody_Wolf Bloody Wolf
item.description:
@Bloody_Wolf wrote:

How do you make it so your run energy, coordinates, and your players online numbers change every 500ms??

~On my server they don’t change, they change when you first log in, but will never change again unless you log out/in again.
Then some dude posted that you have to update it every 500ms, so now I’m asking how i do that??

~And is there a way for, when a player changes there attack style, and hits a dummy, they get different xp?
Example: The player changes there attack style to defense or strength, they will get that xp instead of just attack xp all the time.

~Also i added this into my server and it doesn’t seem to be working.

[code]public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) {
}

public void Deleteobjects() {
deletethatobject(3238, 3435); //delete bench
deletethatobject(3255, 3432); //delete Table
deletethatobject(3255, 3434); //delete Table
deletethatobject(3255, 3431); //delete Stool
deletethatobject(3255, 3432); //delete Stool
deletethatobject(3256, 3431); //delete Stool
deletethatobject(3257, 3433); //delete Stool
deletethatobject(3251, 3431); //delete Stool
}[/code]

I entered that code right under the section where globalobjects were made.

Helps appreciated! ;D

Read full topic
